「二次利用の促進のための府省のデータ公開に関する基本的考え方（ガイドライン）」の: See "3 Concept of Expanding Publication of Data in Machine-Readable Data Format" and Attachment 2, "Considerations in Preparing Data for Numerical (Tables), Text, and Geospatial Information" in "Basic Idea on Data Publication by Ministries and Agencies to Promote Secondary Use (Guidelines)".
「我が国におけるオープンサイエンス推進のあり方について」（平成27年３月30日）: According to the "How Open Science should be promoted in Japan" (March 30, 2015), among research results funded by public research funds, research data as evidence for papers and theses should be made public in principle, and other research data as results of research and development should also be made public to the extent possible. It is desirable." The "Publication of Research Data" is a public document.
「新たなオープンデータの展開に向けて」（平成27年６月30日 高度情報通信ネット: The "Toward the Development of New Open Data" (decided by the Strategic Headquarters for the Promotion of an Advanced Information and Telecommunications Network Society on June 30, 2015) and "Open Data 2.0" (decided by the Strategic Headquarters for the Promotion of an Advanced Information and Telecommunications Network Society on May 20, 2016) have shifted from initiatives focusing on the release of data to "problem-solving open data" that is based on the use of data. The decision was made by the Strategic Headquarters for the Promotion of an Advanced Information and Telecommunications Network Society on May 20, 2016.
「機械判読」とは、コンピュータプログラムが自動的にデータを加工、編集等できること: Machine-readable" means that a computer program can automatically process or edit the data.
「機械判読に適した度合」には、人手をどれだけ要さずに、コンピュータがデータを再利: There are several levels of "machine readability," depending on how much data can be reused by a computer without requiring human intervention. For a computer to automatically reuse data, it must be able to identify (decipher) the logical structure of the data and process the values in the structure (numbers in tables, text, etc.).
このようなリストを作成するため平成29年度中に各府省庁が保有するデータの棚卸しを: In order to create such a list, an inventory of data held by each government ministry and agency will be made public during FY 2009, and an attempt will be made to hold a round table to discuss how data should be disclosed and utilized by the public and private sectors (the private sector includes businesses, researchers, citizens, etc.) in fields where there are high needs, etc. After such a list is made public. The roundtable will discuss how public and private sector data, including data held by local governments and businesses (including independent administrative agencies), should be disclosed and utilized.
この検討は、当該データの利用目的等を特定するなど必要な条件を付し、信頼しうる関係: It is appropriate for this discussion to be conducted in a closed environment, such as in-camera, within trusted parties, with necessary conditions, such as specifying the purpose of use of the data. Limited disclosure should be done with an eye toward the future conversion to open data. However, if the results of the review indicate that there are problems with the conversion to open data, the reasons for such problems should, in principle, be made public.
なお、①個人情報が含まれるもの、②国や公共の安全、秩序の維持に支障を及ぼすおそれ: If there is a request to release information that is not appropriate for release, such as information that (1) contains personal information, (2) could hinder the maintenance of national or public safety or order, or (3) could harm the rights and interests of corporations or individuals, the reason why the information cannot be released as open data should be disclosed. In principle, the reason why the information cannot be released as open data shall be disclosed.
なお、国民への情報公開の観点から、人が読むという従来からの利用形態に適したデータ: From the viewpoint of information disclosure to the public, data will continue to be released in a data format suitable for the traditional form of use of human readers, but even in this case, it must be possible to search and extract text.
また、ベンチャー企業等による多様な新サービスやビジネスの創出、企業活動の効率化等: It will also promote the creation of diverse new services and businesses by venture companies, etc., and the streamlining of corporate activities, thereby contributing to the economic revitalization of Japan as a whole.
また、電力・ガス、通信・放送、交通等の公益事業分野の事業者については、その公益性: In addition, it is desirable for businesses in the public utility sector, such as electric power and gas, telecommunications and broadcasting, and transportation, to promote open data based on these basic guidelines and user needs, in light of their public interest nature.
イベント情報、公共交通機関の混雑率、または災害・防災情報など、一定時間経過毎に情: Data that needs to be updated at regular intervals, such as event information, public transportation congestion rates, or disaster/disaster prevention information.
オープンデータとは言えないものの、データ提供システムの維持管理に要するコストを限: In some cases, the cost of maintaining and managing the data provision system is covered by collecting fees from a limited number of users, although this is not open data.
オープンデータに係る利用者のニーズ（要望）・意見を積極的に収集・把握し、政府一体: In order to actively collect and understand the needs (requests) and opinions of users regarding open data, and reflect them in government-wide efforts, a comprehensive consultation service regarding open data will be established in the Cabinet Secretariat's IT Strategy Office. In addition, each government ministry and agency will also set up a consultation counter and actively respond to individual inquiries from users regarding open data.
オープンデータの推進に当たっては、利用者ニーズを的確に反映しながら進めることが重: In promoting open data, it is important to accurately reflect user needs. For this purpose, each government agency should release a list of the data it possesses and the status of its release to the public in order to grasp the needs of users, including potential ones, and release the data in a form that meets their needs.
データの迅速な公開やその鮮度の維持が重要なデータについては、可能な限り迅速に公開: For data for which prompt release of data and maintenance of its freshness are important, data should be released as promptly as possible and updated in a timely and appropriate manner. In addition, the cycle of data updating will be clearly indicated so that users can understand the timing of updating in advance.
今後、行政目的で作成されるデータについては、本指針に基づき、オープンデータとして: In the future, it will be necessary to ensure that data created for administrative purposes are developed based on the assumption that they will be released as open data in accordance with these guidelines, and the Cabinet Secretariat's IT Strategy Office is required to grasp the status of development by each government agency and make the necessary adjustments.
但し、セキュリティの理由により、利用者に対し、事前登録を求めたり、データへのアク: However, for security reasons, measures such as requiring users to register in advance and setting restrictions on how to access data may be taken.
例えば、一部のデータは有償だが、残りのデータは無償とすること等も考えらえる。\n: For example, some data may be paid for, but the rest may be free of charge.
例えば、各府省庁が公表している統計データ等。\n: For example, statistical data published by various government ministries and agencies.
公共データについて、オープンデータを前提として情報システムや業務プロセス全体の企: The public data is the planning, development, and operation of information systems and business processes as a whole on the premise of open data.
公共データの二次利用可能な形での公開とその活用を促進する意義・目的は、次のとおり: The significance and purpose of promoting the release and utilization of public data in a form that can be used for secondary purposes are as follows.
公共データは国民共有の財産であるとの認識に立ち、政策（法令、予算を含む）の企画・: Based on the recognition that public data is property shared by the public, all data held by government ministries and agencies, including data on which policies (including laws, regulations, and budgets) are based for planning and formulation, shall be released as open data in principle.
公開するデータについては、機械判読に適した構造及びデータ形式で掲載することを原則: In principle, the data to be released shall be published in a structure and data format suitable for machine-reading. Efforts will be made to release data in terms and formats that are easier to use, with reference to the "5-star" index used as an evaluation index for the level of achievement of the Common Vocabulary Infrastructure and open data.
公開するデータに関して、それがどのようなデータであるかを示す情報。例えば、タイト: Information on the type of data to be released. For example, property information such as title, name of the public organization, creator (department name), etc., and keywords for data search. For details on other items, see "(2) Information on metadata, etc. provided on the data catalog site" in "Information for Developers" on Data.go.jp (https://www.data.go.jp/for-developer/for-developer).
公開できない理由を公開することだけで、公開できない情報（不開示情報）を開示するこ: If disclosing the reason why the information cannot be disclosed alone would result in the disclosure of information that cannot be disclosed (nondisclosure information), the reason may not be disclosed.
内閣官房IT総合戦略室は、関係府省庁と連携し、データ構造やデータ形式の標準化を引: The Cabinet Secretariat IT Strategy Office will continue to promote standardization of data structures and formats in cooperation with relevant government ministries and agencies. In addition, data containing corporate information shall be annotated with a corporate number.
内閣官房IT総合戦略室は政府CIOの下、各府省庁と連携し政府全体のオープンデータ: The Cabinet Secretariat IT Strategy Office, under the leadership of the government CIO, will work with government ministries and agencies to plan and coordinate open data for the entire government, and promote government-wide open data initiatives by reviewing and following up on each policy, including the status of open data disclosure by each government agency. The Cabinet Secretariat will also promote government-wide open data initiatives. In addition, the IT Strategy Office, Cabinet Secretariat, in cooperation with relevant ministries and agencies, will promote initiatives by local governments.
利用者を増加させ、個別の利用者の負担額を低減する取組の検討\n: Consideration of efforts to increase the number of users and reduce the burden on individual users
利用者負担での提供とすることが社会的経済的に適当かどうかの再検討\n: (6) Reexamination of whether it is socially and economically appropriate to provide data at the user's expense.
各府省庁のウェブサイト上で公開されるデータについては、原則、政府標準利用規約を適: In principle, the Government Standard Terms of Use shall be applied to data published on the websites of government ministries and agencies, and secondary use of published data shall be actively promoted, except for data for which secondary use is not permitted based on specific and reasonable grounds.
各府省庁は、ウェブサイトで容易に検索・利用できる形でデータを公開する。特に「各府: Each government agency shall make data publicly available on its website in a form that can be easily searched and used. In particular, useful data such as "data that can only be provided by each ministry and agency," "highly reliable data that can serve as basic data in various fields," or "data with real-time characteristics" are expected to be in high demand by society and should be actively released. In addition, from the viewpoint of user convenience and system load and efficiency, a mechanism to enable batch downloading and provision through APIs should be promoted.
各府省庁は、オープンデータ・バイ・デザインの考えに基づき、行政保有データを利用者: Based on the concept of open data by design, each government agency should take necessary measures from the planning and design stages of administrative procedures and information systems to release government-owned data in a form that is easy for users to utilize. The Cabinet Secretariat IT Strategy Office will provide necessary advice on the measures taken by each government agency under the government CIO.
各府省庁（施設等機関、地方支分部局等、府省庁に属する組織を含む。）が、その名称に: Each government ministry and agency (including organizations belonging to a government ministry and agency, such as institutions, etc., local branch offices, etc.) (2) The term "government agency" broadly includes websites on the Internet, database sites, individual business sites, etc., established by government agencies (including institutions such as facilities, local branch offices, etc., and organizations belonging to government agencies) in their names.
各府省情報化統括責任者（府省CIO）は、府省庁内におけるオープンデータの取組を推: The Chief Information Technology Officer (CIO) of each ministry and agency shall promote open data initiatives within the ministry and agencies, and also promote open data initiatives by independent administrative agencies, public utilities, etc. In addition, the Chief Information Technology Officer (CIO) of each ministry and agency shall promote open data initiatives within the ministry and agencies. In addition, the deputy CIOs of each ministry and agency shall assist the CIOs in directing and supervising open data measures within the ministry and agency. 6.
営利目的、非営利目的を問わず二次利用可能なルールが適用されたもの\n: Data to which the rules for secondary use have been applied, whether for commercial or non-commercial purposes.
国、地方公共団体及び事業者が保有する官民データのうち、国民誰もがインターネット等: Open data is defined as publicly available public and private data held by the national government, local governments, and businesses that can be easily used (processed, edited, redistributed, etc.) by any citizen via the Internet, etc., in any of the following ways.
国や地方公共団体においてデータ活用により得られた情報を根拠として政策や施策の企画: The planning and formulation of policies and measures by the national and local governments based on information obtained through the use of data (EBPM: Evidence Based Policy Making) will lead to the promotion of effective and efficient public administration.
地方公共団体は、官民データ法の趣旨及び本基本指針を踏まえてオープンデータを推進す: Local governments are required to promote open data based on the purpose of the Public-Private Data Act and these Basic Guidelines.
安価かつ安全な最新技術を活用することによる、提供に係る経費の低減化の検討\n: Consideration of reducing expenses related to provision by utilizing the latest inexpensive and safe technology
官民データ法第11条第1項では、地方公共団体は、国と同様に、保有するデータを国民: According to Article 11, Paragraph 1 of the Public-Private Data Act, local governments, like the national government, shall take necessary measures to make the data they hold readily available to the public.
官民データ法第11条第２項では、事業者（独立行政法人を含む）は、公益の増進に資す: Article 11, Paragraph 2 of the Public-Private Data Act stipulates that business operators (including independent administrative agencies) shall endeavor to take necessary measures to make data that contributes to the promotion of public interest readily available to the public.
官民データ活用推進戦略会議決定\n: Strategic Council for the Promotion of Public-Private Data Utilization
平成28年12月14日に公布・施行された「官民データ活用推進基本法」（以下「官民: The "Basic Act on the Promotion of Public-Private Data Utilization" (hereinafter referred to as the "Public-Private Data Act"), which was promulgated and enforced on December 14, 2008 The Basic Act on the Promotion of Public-Private Data Utilization ("Public-Private Data Act"), promulgated and enforced on December 14, 2016, aims to contribute to the realization of a society in which citizens can live safely and securely and a comfortable living environment by promoting the utilization of public-private data, and stipulates the easy use of public and private data held by the national government, local governments, and businesses, among others.
広範な主体による公共データの活用が進展することで、創意工夫を活かした多様なサービ: The utilization of public data by a wide range of entities will enable the prompt and efficient provision of a variety of services that take advantage of originality and ingenuity, and the provision and improvement of public services through collaboration between the public and private sectors, thereby enabling appropriate responses to environmental changes such as diversification of needs and values and technological innovation, as well as the resolution of various issues facing Japan, including the severe fiscal situation and the rapid aging of society with a declining birthrate. The project will also contribute to the resolution of various issues facing Japan, such as the severe financial situation and the rapid aging of society and declining birthrate.
我が国においては、平成23年３月11日の東日本大震災以降、政府、地方公共団体や事: In Japan, since the Great East Japan Earthquake on March 11, 2011, there has been an increased awareness of the need to disclose and utilize data held by the government, local governments, and businesses.
推進に際しては、国や地方公共団体が公開するデータを横断的に活用することができるよ: In promoting open data, it is desirable that efforts be made to release data based on standard formats and rules so that data released by the national government and local governments can be used across the board. It is also effective for multiple organizations to jointly launch an open data portal site.
政府においては、公共データは国民共有の財産であるとの認識を示した「電子行政オープ: The government has been promoting open data initiatives based on the "e-Government Open Data Strategy" (decided by the Strategic Headquarters for the Promotion of an Advanced Information and Telecommunications Network Society on July 4, 2012), which recognizes that public data is a property shared by all citizens.
政府は、オープンデータに関する専門家等の派遣、地方公共団体において特に公開が望ま: The government will actively support open data efforts by local governments by dispatching experts on open data, presenting fields and data items that local governments particularly want to release, providing case studies and guidance on advanced efforts, and providing tools for human resource development.
政府機関のウェブサイトで公開されているデータの二次利用を促進する観点から、統一的: Rules for the use of the websites of government ministries and agencies, presented as a unified template from the perspective of promoting the secondary use of data published on the websites of government agencies. Attachment 1 "Government Standard Terms of Use (Version 2.0)" of "Basic Idea on Publication of Data by Ministries and Agencies to Promote Secondary Use (Guidelines)".
政策立案等に用いられた公共データが公開されることで、国民は政策等に関して十分な分: By making public data used for policy planning, etc. available to the public, the public will be able to fully analyze and judge policies, etc., thereby increasing the transparency of public administration and public trust in public administration.
既に紙によるものを含め、利用者の求めに応じて情報公開を含め公開されている情報につ: Information that has already been made publicly available, including information disclosure at the request of users, including paper-based information, is excluded. The concept and operation of data subject to limited release (e.g., the decision-making process for limited release and the system for monitoring and evaluating progress) will be further discussed in the future, as necessary.
更に、政府のオープンデータ全体の横断的検索を可能とし、データの活用を促進するため: Furthermore, in order to enable cross-sectional searches of the entire government's open data and promote data utilization, meta-information such as the outline and format of the data will be registered on the government's data catalog site "DATA.GO.JP" after being treated as "CC0 1.0 Worldwide" as defined by Creative Commons, and will be made JP, a government data catalog site, and make it publicly available.
本基本指針は、各種施策の成果や国民・事業者等の意見要望等を踏まえつつ、技術動向、: These Basic Guidelines shall be flexibly revised in response to changes in technological trends, the international environment, and other circumstances, while taking into account the results of various measures and the opinions and requests of the public and business operators.
本文書は、これまでの取組を踏まえ、オープンデータ・バイ・デザインの考えに基づき、: This document summarizes the basic guidelines for the national government, local governments, and business operators to open and utilize public data in the future, based on the idea of open data by design, in light of past efforts.
法令又は合理的な根拠によりオープンデータとして公開できない場合（二次利用に制限が: In cases where data cannot be released as open data (including cases where there are restrictions on secondary use) due to laws and regulations or reasonable grounds, this should be indicated in detail.
無償で利用できるもの\n: Data that can be used free of charge
特に構造化しやすいデータはより活用がしやすいデータ形式である「３つ星（CSVやX: In particular, data that is easy to structure should, in principle, be released in "3-star (CSV, XML, and other formats)" or higher, a data format that is easier to utilize. In addition, efforts will be made to improve the environment for meta-information disclosure, such as the use of data catalog sites, so that all publicly available data, including data that is difficult to structure, can be easily visualized and APIs can be used.
特定の機能に限定されず共通で利用できるフォーマット（CSV、XML）。\n: A format (CSV, XML) that can be used commonly without being limited to specific functions.
独立行政法人や大学等においては、国費によって運営されていること又は実施している事: It is desirable for independent administrative agencies, universities, etc. to promote open data initiatives in accordance with these basic guidelines, in light of the fact that some projects and research are operated or conducted with government funds.
統計情報等の行列や階層による表現が可能な情報。\n: Information that can be expressed in matrices or hierarchies, such as statistical information.
表が含まれるデータをCSVで公開する場合は「オープンデータガイド第2.1版」の「: When publishing data containing tables in CSV, refer to "8.3.2 Guidelines for Tabular Data" in the "Open Data Guide Version 2.1" (http://www.vled.or.jp/results/OpenDataGuide_v21_fix.pdf).
震災関連情報の提供に関し、情報の加工が容易なファイル形式による情報提供について協: Regarding the provision of earthquake-related information, a request was made for cooperation in providing information in a file format that allows easy processing of information, and road traffic information held by businesses was made public and utilized.
高度情報通信ネットワーク社会推進戦略本部・\n: Strategic Headquarters for the Promotion of an Advanced Information and Telecommunications Network Society
（１）オープンデータ・バイ・デザインの推進\n: (1) Promotion of open data by design
（１）国民参加・官民協働の推進を通じた諸課題の解決、経済活性化\n: (1) Solving various problems and revitalizing the economy through the promotion of public participation and public-private collaboration
（１）行政保有データのオープンデータ公開の原則\n: (1) Principle of open data release of government-owned data
（２）公開データの二次利用に関するルール\n: (2) Rules for secondary use of public data
（２）行政の高度化・効率化\n: (2) Increasing the sophistication and efficiency of public administration
（６）有償データの公開に係る原則\n: (6) Principles pertaining to the release of paid data
２．に示したとおり、各府省庁が保有するデータはすべてオープンデータとして公開され: As indicated in 2. above, in principle, all data held by government ministries and agencies should be released as open data, but there is some information that is difficult to immediately release as open data for some reason. If there is a risk that releasing data that is not currently available to the public as open data may hinder the maintenance of the safety of citizens' lives, etc., a comparative study of the effects and risks must be conducted prior to the release of such data. From the perspective of gradually converting such data to open data, it is effective to limit the purpose, scope, and recipients of use of the data (hereinafter referred to as "limited release") and release the data to the public for their utilization. The limited release of data is effective from the viewpoint of promoting open data in a phased manner. In addition, the government ministries and agencies that conduct limited disclosure should also disclose the reason for such disclosure and their approach (e.g., a plan to show how the data will be utilized among relevant parties under the limited disclosure).
２．に示した定義のとおり、データ提供システムの維持管理に要するコストを限定された: As per the definition given in 2. above, if the cost of maintaining and managing the data provision system is covered by collecting fees from a limited number of users, it cannot be considered open data, but it is desirable to apply the rules for secondary use in accordance with the treatment of such data (except those for which secondary use is not allowed based on concrete and reasonable grounds (except for those that are not allowed for secondary use). In addition, such fees should be reviewed from the following perspectives, after clearly indicating the basis for calculation of expenses related to provision and the timing of certain considerations.
４．オープンデータの公開・活用を促す仕組み\n: 4. Mechanisms to promote the release and use of open data
６．地方公共団体、独立行政法人、事業者におけるオープンデータの取組\n: 6. Open data initiatives by local governments, independent administrative agencies, and businesses
